question: [File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Struct] [Copy Semantics] Can copying Hasher instances create multiple finalized hashes from the same intermediate state, enabling signature reuse attacks? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Struct] [Buffer Exposure] After destructuring Hasher to extract buffer, can the buffer be modified before being passed to SHA2-256? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Error] [Length Assertion Messages] Do the error messages provide enough information for debugging, or could they leak sensitive information about expected formats? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Error] [Missing Validations] Are there any parameters in generate_update_msg or generate_attestation_msg that lack length validation but should have it? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Error] [Panic Conditions] Can any vector operations (reverse, append, push_back) panic due to capacity limits, causing transaction failures? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Integration] [Off-Chain Compatibility] Does the hash construction exactly match Switchboard's off-chain oracle implementation, or could subtle differences cause all signatures to fail? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Integration] [Version Compatibility] If Switchboard updates their message format, will old messages still verify, or could version mismatches brick the oracle system? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Integration] [Signature Scheme] Does the message format support the expected signature scheme (ECDSA secp256k1), or could incompatible schemes be used accidentally? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Integration] [Message Length] Are there maximum message length constraints from the signature verification functions that could cause very large messages to fail? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Performance] [Gas Cost Attack] Can an attacker force expensive vector operations (multiple append/reverse calls) to cause high gas costs for oracle updates? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Performance] [Buffer Growth] Can repeated message generation without cleanup cause memory bloat in long-running transactions? (Low)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Performance] [SHA2-256 Cost] Can very large message buffers cause SHA2-256 hashing to exceed transaction gas limits, DoSing oracle updates? (Medium)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Attack] [Cross-Message Forgery] Can an attacker combine parts of valid update messages and attestation messages to create hybrid forgeries? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Attack] [Parameter Swapping] Can swapping queue_key and feed_hash values create valid-looking hashes that pass verification for wrong feeds? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Attack] [Timestamp Skew] Can using timestamps far in the past or future bypass consuming contract's validation logic? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Attack] [Value Manipulation] Can crafting decimal values with specific bit patterns cause hash collisions with different prices? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Attack] [Slothash Bypass] Can using default/zero slothash values bypass Solana chain state verification? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Attack] [Oracle Impersonation] Can an attacker generate attestation messages for oracles they don't control by exploiting hash construction weaknesses? (Critical)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Attack] [Multi-Queue Exploit] Can valid signatures from one queue be replayed to another queue by manipulating message construction? (High)

[File: volo-vault/local_dependencies/switchboard_sui/on_demand/sources/utils/hash.move] [Edge Case] [Unicode in Bytes] Can special Unicode characters or null bytes in vector parameters cause parsing errors in off-chain verification? (Medium)
